title: Add output to our deposit generation tool
body:
### Description
As a user, I want more verbose output when I run ~`teku validator generate`~ `teku validator generate-and-register` so that I know what's going on.

Currently, in the successful case, there is no screen output at all after confirmation is requested.

### Acceptance Criteria
* Confirmation of success or failure is displayed
* Transaction ID and network name is displayed
* List of validator and withdrawal key files generated is displayed
* List of public keys generated is displayed
* Some in progress guidance is displayed: such as "Sending transaction to contract X on the Y network."
* All errors are handled gracefully with pleasant output.
In making this change it’s important not to break the case where the keys are output to standard out. It’s used in acceptance tests.

@benjaminion Detailed output (encrypted keystore enabled)

~~~
./teku validator generate-and-register \
--encrypted-keystore-enabled=true \
--number-of-validators=5 \
--eth1-deposit-contract-address=dddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddd \
--eth1-private-key=8f2a55949038a9610f50fb23b5883af3b4ecb3c3bb792cbcefbd1542c692be63 \
--eth1-endpoint=http://localhost:8545 \
--network=minimal
You are about to submit 5 transactions of 32.000000000 Eth to contract address [0xdddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddd] on network [minimal].
This is irreversible, please make sure you understand the consequences. Are you sure you want to continue? [y/n]y

--encrypted-keystore-enabled=true \
--number-of-validators=5 \
--eth1-deposit-contract-address=dddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddddd \

Failed to send deposit transaction: class java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException : java.net.ConnectException: Failed to connect to localhost/[0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1]:8545

This is a great improvement!

Just a couple of suggestions:
  - It would be good to output the Tx hash when the deposit transaction is sent (as well as when it completes). On Goerli it's not a big deal as you pretty much know you'll be included in the next block. But on mainnet it could be minutes or hours. Having the Tx hash early allows it to be tracked on a block explorer.
  - I'd be happy to omit the blank lines. Since there's async stuff going on the chronology is messed up anyway, and it's hard to format nicely. Might as well just dump it all out continuously and people can grep through it as needed.
